revised_title: Sex Ratio in Human Populations: A Study of Cuban Data
tldr: This article examines the proportion of male and female births among white and colored populations in Cuba, using census data and records from Dr. Carlos J. Finlay. The author discusses the influence of various factors, such as nutrition and physical conditions, on the sex ratio, and explores the role of heredity and natural selection in determining sex. The study highlights the importance of understanding the sex problem and its implications for human populations.
